maml:description.maml:para: This cmdlet establishes a connection to the specified VMware Aria Operations server.
This cmdlet establishes a connection to the VMware Aria Operations server specified by the -Server parameter.

The connect and disconnect operations for a server are using a reference counting mechanism. Every server is identified by its connection string which contains server, user name, and authentication source. If there is already an existing connection to the server, a new connection is not established. Instead, the cmdlet returns the object which represents the existing connection. The RefCount property of the object is incremented by one. Note that a new object is not created. Therefore, the RefCount of the previously returned object will be updated as well. When a server is disconnected, then its RefCount property is decreased by one. If this number becomes equal to zero, then the server is disconnected.

PowerCLI supports a list of default VMware Aria Operations servers. When an operation is performed, if the target servers cannot be determined from the specified parameters, the cmdlet runs against the servers in the default server list. They are kept in a global variable called $DefaultOMServers. It is of an array type and its initial value is an empty array. When you connect to a server, the server is added at the beginning of the array, unless -NotDefault parameter is specified. When you disconnect from a server, the server is removed from the $DefaultOMServers variable. When all servers are removed from the variable, its value is an empty array. You can modify the value of the $DefaultOMServers variable manually.
Specifies the IP or DNS addresses of the VMware Aria Operations servers you want to connect to.
Specifies the authentication source type. The default authentication source type value is LocalUser. You can specify ActiveDirectory, OpenLDAP, or VC as authentication source type values.
Suppresses all user interface prompts during the cmdlet execution.
Specifies that you do not want to save the specified servers as default servers.

Specifies the password you want to use for authenticating with the server. For more information about the server authentication logic of PowerCLI, run "help about_server_authentication". Note: If the password contains special characters, enclose the entire string in single quotes (').
Specifies the port on the server you want to use for the connection. If not specified, the default port value is 443.
Indicates that you want to save the specified credentials in the local credential store.

Specifies the user name you want to use for authenticating with the server. For more information about the server authentication logic of PowerCLI, run "help about_server_authentication". Note: If the user name contains special characters, enclose the entire string in single quotes (').
Specifies the IP or DNS addresses of the VMware Aria Operations servers you want to connect to.
Specifies the authentication source type. The default authentication source type value is LocalUser. You can specify ActiveDirectory, OpenLDAP, or VC as authentication source type values.

Specifies a PSCredential object that contains credentials for authenticating with the server. For more information about the server authentication logic of PowerCLI, run "help about_server_authentication".
Suppresses all user interface prompts during the cmdlet execution.
Specifies that you do not want to save the specified servers as default servers.
Specifies the port on the server you want to use for the connection. If not specified, the default port value is 443.
Indicates that you want to save the specified credentials in the local credential store.
Specifies the IP or DNS addresses of the VMware Aria Operations servers you want to connect to.
Suppresses all user interface prompts during the cmdlet execution.
Specifies that you do not want to save the specified servers as default servers.
Specifies the port on the server you want to use for the connection. If not specified, the default port value is 443.
Specifies the ID of an existing VMware Aria Operations session you want to reestablish.

Indicates that you want to select a connection server from a list of recently connected servers. If Menu is provided, the cmdlet retrieves a list of the last visited servers and enters a nested command prompt, so that you can select a server from the list.
Specifies the authentication source type. The default authentication source type value is LocalUser. You can specify ActiveDirectory, OpenLDAP, or VC as authentication source type values.

Specifies a PSCredential object that contains credentials for authenticating with the server. For more information about the server authentication logic of PowerCLI, run "help about_server_authentication".
Suppresses all user interface prompts during the cmdlet execution.

Indicates that you want to select a connection server from a list of recently connected servers. If Menu is provided, the cmdlet retrieves a list of the last visited servers and enters a nested command prompt, so that you can select a server from the list.
Specifies that you do not want to save the specified servers as default servers.

Specifies the password you want to use for authenticating with the server. For more information about the server authentication logic of PowerCLI, run "help about_server_authentication". Note: If the password contains special characters, enclose the entire string in single quotes (').
Specifies the port on the server you want to use for the connection. If not specified, the default port value is 443.
Indicates that you want to save the specified credentials in the local credential store.
Specifies the IP or DNS addresses of the VMware Aria Operations servers you want to connect to.
Specifies the ID of an existing VMware Aria Operations session you want to reestablish.

Specifies the user name you want to use for authenticating with the server. For more information about the server authentication logic of PowerCLI, run "help about_server_authentication". Note: If the user name contains special characters, enclose the entire string in single quotes (').

dev:remarks.maml:para: Connects to a VMware Aria Operations server by using the User and Password parameters.
Connects to a VMware Aria Operations server as a vCenter Server user, imported from the monitored vCenter Server system.
Connects to a VMware Aria Operations server with an existing session.
Connects to a vRealize Operations server by using a credentials object.

maml:description.maml:para: This cmdlet closes the connection to one or more VMware Aria Operations servers.
This cmdlet closes the connection to one or more VMware Aria Operations servers.

When no servers and no user name are specified, and if there is only one connected server in $DefaultOMServers variable, this server is disconnected. If there is no connected server, the cmdlet throws a terminating error.
This functionality is using the reference counting mechanism. For more information about the mechanism, see Connect-OMServer.

When there are no more active connections to the server it gets disconnected and then it is removed from the $DefaultOMServers variable. For more information about this variable, see Connect-OMServer.
If -Force is specified, the server is disconnected even if there is more than one connection to it.
Specifies the VMware Aria Operations servers you want to disconnect from.
Specifies that you want to remove all existing connections to the specified servers.
If the value is $true, indicates that the cmdlet asks for confirmation before running. If the value is $false, the cmdlet runs without asking for user confirmation.
Indicates that the cmdlet is run only to display the changes that would be made and actually no objects are modified.
Specifies that you want to remove all existing connections to the specified servers.
Specifies the VMware Aria Operations servers you want to disconnect from.
If the value is $true, indicates that the cmdlet asks for confirmation before running. If the value is $false, the cmdlet runs without asking for user confirmation.
Indicates that the cmdlet is run only to display the changes that would be made and actually no objects are modified.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Disconnects the specified VMware Aria Operations server and closes all existing connections to it.
Disconnects all connected VMware Aria Operations servers without asking for confirmation.

maml:description.maml:para: This cmdlet retrieves alerts from the specified VMware Aria Operations server.
This cmdlet retrieves alerts from the specified VMware Aria Operations server.
Filters the alerts by name.
Filters the alerts by definition.
Filters the alerts by the user who owns the alert.
Filters the alerts by the state of user interaction with the alert. For example, the state can be Open, Assigned, or Suspended.
Filters the alerts by level of importance. The possible values are None, Information, Warning, Immediate, Critical, SymptomBased, and Unknown.
Filters the alerts by level of urgency. The possible values are Health, Risk, Efficiency, and Unknown.
Filters the alerts by the resource for which the alert was raised.

Specifies the VMware Aria Operations server from which you want to retrieve alerts. The value can be the connection object returned by the Connect-OMServer cmdlet or the object's name, which can be the IP or DNS address of the server machine.
Filters the alerts by current state. The possible values are Active, Inactive, and Unknown.
Filters the alerts by the subtype of the alert.
Filters the alerts by the type of the alert.
Filters the alerts by ID.

Specifies the VMware Aria Operations server from which you want to retrieve alerts. The value can be the connection object returned by the Connect-OMServer cmdlet or the object's name, which can be the IP or DNS address of the server machine.

Lists all alerts assigned to a specified user.

maml:description.maml:para: This cmdlet retrieves alert definitions from the specified VMware Aria Operations server.

This cmdlet retrieves alert definitions from the specified VMware Aria Operations server. The alert definition is a template that contains a set of symptoms, recommendations, and actions. When at least one symptom is breached, an alert with the same name as the alert definition is generated.
Filters the alert definitions by the name of the alert.
Filters the alert definitions by the type of adapter that manages the selected base object type.
Filters the alert definitions by level of importance. The possible values are None, Information, Warning, Immediate, Critical, SymptomBased, and Unknown.
Filters the alert definitions by level of urgency. The possible values are Health, Risk, Efficiency, and Unknown.
Filters the alert definitions by the type of the resource for which the alert was raised.

Specifies the Operations Management server from which you want to retrieve alerts. The value can be the connection object returned by the Connect-OMServer cmdlet or the object's name, which can be the IP or DNS address of the server machine.
Filters the alert definitions by the subtype of the alert.
Filters the alert definitions by the type of the alert.
Filters the alert definitions by ID.

Specifies the Operations Management server from which you want to retrieve alerts. The value can be the connection object returned by the Connect-OMServer cmdlet or the object's name, which can be the IP or DNS address of the server machine.
Filters the alert definitions by the type of adapter that manages the selected base object type.
Filters the alert definitions by level of importance. The possible values are None, Information, Warning, Immediate, Critical, SymptomBased, and Unknown.
Filters the alert definitions by ID.
Filters the alert definitions by level of urgency. The possible values are Health, Risk, Efficiency, and Unknown.
Filters the alert definitions by the name of the alert.
Filters the alert definitions by the type of the resource for which the alert was raised.

maml:description.maml:para: This cmdlet retrieves alert subtypes from the specified VMware Aria Operations server.

This cmdlet retrieves alert subtypes from the specified VMware Aria Operations server. The alert subtype helps you categorize the alerts by areas specific to VMware Aria Operations, so that you can assign certain types of alerts to specific system administrators.
Filters the alert subtypes by name.
Filters the alert subtypes by the type of the alert.

Specifies the VMware Aria Operations server from which you want to retrieve alerts. The value can be the connection object returned by the Connect-OMServer cmdlet or the object's name, which can be the IP or DNS address of the server machine.

Filters the alert subtypes by the type of the alert.

Filters the alert subtypes by name.

Specifies the VMware Aria Operations server from which you want to retrieve alerts. The value can be the connection object returned by the Connect-OMServer cmdlet or the object's name, which can be the IP or DNS address of the server machine.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Lists all available alert subtypes.
Retrieves all alert subtypes named 'Performance'.
Retrieves all applicable alert subtypes for an alert type.

maml:description.maml:para: This cmdlet retrieves alert types from the specified VMware Aria Operations server.

This cmdlet retrieves alert types from the specified VMware Aria Operations server. The alert type helps you categorize the alerts by general areas, such as network or storage, so that you can assign certain types of alerts to specific system administrators.
Filters the alert types by ID.

Specifies the VMware Aria Operations server from which you want to retrieve alerts. The value can be the connection object returned by the Connect-OMServer cmdlet or the object's name, which can be the IP or DNS address of the server machine.

maml:description.maml:para: This cmdlet retrieves VMware Aria Operations resource objects.
This cmdlet retrieves VMware Aria Operations resource objects.
Filters the resource objects by name.
Filters the resource objects by the type of adapter that manages them. If AdapterKind is not specified, resource objects from all adapter types are retrieved.
If specified, retrieves only resources whose State property is empty.
Filters the resource objects by the type of the resource. If ResourceKind is not specified, resource objects of all types are retrieved.

Specifies the VMware Aria Operations server from which you want to retrieve alerts. The value can be the connection object returned by the Connect-OMServer cmdlet or the object's name, which can be the IP or DNS address of the server machine.

Specifies the solution object whose respective VMware Aria Operations resource counterpart to retrieve. The supported object types from the vCenter Server solution are Cluster Compute Resource, Datacenter, Datastore, Datastore Cluster, Folder, Host System, Resource Pool, vCenter Server, Virtual Machine, vSphere Distributed Port Group, and vSphere Distributed Switch.
Filters the resource objects by ID.

Specifies the VMware Aria Operations server from which you want to retrieve alerts. The value can be the connection object returned by the Connect-OMServer cmdlet or the object's name, which can be the IP or DNS address of the server machine.
Filters the resource objects by the type of adapter that manages them. If AdapterKind is not specified, resource objects from all adapter types are retrieved.

Specifies the solution object whose respective VMware Aria Operations resource counterpart to retrieve. The supported object types from the vCenter Server solution are Cluster Compute Resource, Datacenter, Datastore, Datastore Cluster, Folder, Host System, Resource Pool, vCenter Server, Virtual Machine, vSphere Distributed Port Group, and vSphere Distributed Switch.
Filters the resource objects by ID.
Filters the resource objects by name.
If specified, retrieves only resources whose State property is empty.
Filters the resource objects by the type of the resource. If ResourceKind is not specified, resource objects of all types are retrieved.

Specifies the VMware Aria Operations server from which you want to retrieve alerts. The value can be the connection object returned by the Connect-OMServer cmdlet or the object's name, which can be the IP or DNS address of the server machine.

maml:alert.maml:para: The Get-OMResource cmdlet now supports resources that are monitored by multiple adapter instances. The properties of the OMResource output object type ('AdapterInstanceId', 'Status', 'State', and 'StatusMessage') have been deprecated in favor of the newer 'ResourceStatus' property. It is an array of objects, each one representing the status of the resource for a particular adapter instance. The deprecated properties will be removed in a future release.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Retrieves the VMware Aria Operations resource object that is counterpart of the vCenter Server cluster object.
Note: The vCenter Server instance that manages the "MyCluster" cluster must be added as a solution instance to the connected VMware Aria Operations server.
Retrieves resource objects by name.
Retrieves all VMware Aria Operations resource objects that represent vCenter Server instances.
Retrieves the resource status for all adapters monitoring the 'MyResource' resource object.

maml:description.maml:para: This cmdlet retrieves statistical data from the specified VMware Aria Operations server.
This cmdlet retrieves statistical data from the specified VMware Aria Operations server.
Specifies the VMware Aria Operations resource you want to retrieve statistical data for.
Specifies the start of the time interval to retrieve statistical data for.
Specifies the multiplier for the aggregation interval length. For example, if IntervalType is WEEKS and IntervalCount is 2, the aggregation interval length is two weeks.
Specifies the aggregation interval length.
Specifies the keys of the statistic counters you want data for. If a specified key is not applicable to the specified VMware Aria Operations resource, that key is skipped.
Specifies the type of aggregation when specifying aggregation interval.

Specifies the VMware Aria Operations server from which you want to retrieve alerts. The value can be the connection object returned by the Connect-OMServer cmdlet or the object's name, which can be the IP or DNS address of the server machine.
Specifies the end of the time interval to retrieve statistical data for.
Specifies the start of the time interval to retrieve statistical data for.
Specifies the multiplier for the aggregation interval length. For example, if IntervalType is WEEKS and IntervalCount is 2, the aggregation interval length is two weeks.
Specifies the aggregation interval length.
Specifies the keys of the statistic counters you want data for. If a specified key is not applicable to the specified VMware Aria Operations resource, that key is skipped.
Specifies the VMware Aria Operations resource you want to retrieve statistical data for.
Specifies the type of aggregation when specifying aggregation interval.

Specifies the VMware Aria Operations server from which you want to retrieve alerts. The value can be the connection object returned by the Connect-OMServer cmdlet or the object's name, which can be the IP or DNS address of the server machine.
Specifies the end of the time interval to retrieve statistical data for.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Retrieves all available raw CPU usage data for a specified host.
Retrieves a collection of statistical samples for a given resource, metric, aggregation, and interval.
Note: Make sure the specified IntervalType and IntervalCount fit in the chosen time interval between $startDate and $endDate.
Retrieves all available memory usage data for the last three months.

maml:description.maml:para: This cmdlet retrieves VMware Aria Operations statistic keys.

This cmdlet retrieves VMware Aria Operations statistic keys for a specified adapter and a specified resource. A statistic key, or a metric key, is an identifier of a VMware Aria Operations metric which can be used to refer to this metric when necessary. For example, you can refer to a metric when retrieving data for it.
Filters the statistic keys by name.
Specifies the vRealize Operations resource kind for which to retrieve the valid statistic counter keys.
Specifies the adapter kind for which to retrieve the valid statistic counter keys.

Specifies the VMware Aria Operations server from which you want to retrieve alerts. The value can be the connection object returned by the Connect-OMServer cmdlet or the object's name, which can be the IP or DNS address of the server machine.
Filters the statistic keys by name.
Specifies the resource object for which to return the valid instance metric keys.
Note: The returned keys that identify metric data for a specific instance object, like a CPU or network adapter, do not contain a description or ExtensionData info.

Specifies the VMware Aria Operations server from which you want to retrieve alerts. The value can be the connection object returned by the Connect-OMServer cmdlet or the object's name, which can be the IP or DNS address of the server machine.
Specifies the vRealize Operations resource kind for which to retrieve the valid statistic counter keys.
Filters the statistic keys by name.
Specifies the resource object for which to return the valid instance metric keys.
Note: The returned keys that identify metric data for a specific instance object, like a CPU or network adapter, do not contain a description or ExtensionData info.
Specifies the adapter kind for which to retrieve the valid statistic counter keys.

Specifies the VMware Aria Operations server from which you want to retrieve alerts. The value can be the connection object returned by the Connect-OMServer cmdlet or the object's name, which can be the IP or DNS address of the server machine.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Retrieves statistic keys whose name begins with 'diskspace|total|'.
Retrieves statistic keys for the 'VMware' adapter kind.
Retrieves statistic keys for the 'Folder' resource kind.
Retrieves statistic keys for the 'MyDatastore' resource.

maml:description.maml:para: This cmdlet retrieves local user accounts from the specified VMware Aria Operations server.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Retrieves a specific user by the user`s email address.
Note: The "admin" user is not returned.
Retrieves all users with names starting with the administrator string.
Note: The "admin" user is not returned.

maml:description.maml:para: This function retrieves all commands of the VMware.VimAutomation.vROps module.
This function retrieves all commands of the VMware.VimAutomation.vROps module, including cmdlets, aliases, and functions.
Specifies the name of the command you want to retrieve.
